conclusion: To determine the temperature of the gas in state D.
At state A, the temperature is given as 300K.
Since AB is an isochoric process at the same temperature, state B is also at 300K.
Since BC represents an isothermal process, the temperature also remains constant at 300K.
The segment BC is a hyperbola, indicating an isothermal process where pV = constant.
At state B, the pressure p_B = 4 atm and volume V_B = 10 L.
At state B, p_B V_B = 40 atm·L.
At state C, the pressure p_C = 2 atm and volume V_C = 40 L.
At state C, p_C V_C = 80 atm·L, confirming the constant product of pressure and volume.
At state D, the pressure p_D = 2 atm and volume V_D = 20 L.
Since the process BD is isobaric (constant pressure), use the relationship V_B/T_B = V_D/T_D.
The temperature of the gas in state D is 600K.
